metadata.title: CVE-2010-2221 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple buffer overflows in the iSNS implementation in isns.c in (1) LinuxSCSI target framework (aka tgt or scsi-target-utils) before 1.0.6, (2)iSCSI Enterprise Target (aka iscsitarget or IET) 1.4.20.1 and earlier, and(3) Generic SCSI Target Subsystem for Linux (aka SCST or iscsi-scst)1.0.1.1 and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service(memory corruption and daemon crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via(a) a long iSCSI Name string in an SCN message or (b) an invalid PDU.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-2221` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tgt - 1:1.0.13-0ubuntu2
tgt-rbd - 1:1.0.13-0ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tgt package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.0.13-0ubuntu2').
